edu.uwm.owyh.model

Class Auth

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uwm.owyh.model.Auth

  • public class Auth
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to determine if users are authorized to view and/or interact with the Web application. Primary class to interact with, set, and remove session variables.

    • Method Summary

      • getSessionVariable

        public static java.lang.Object getSessionVariable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  java.lang.String key)
        Returns the session variable (if it exists) given the property key.
        Parameters:
        request - - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the session info
        key - - Key for the session variable
        Returns:
        the Session variable if it exists. Null otherwise.

      • setSessionVariable

        public static void setSessionVariable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Object attribute)
        Sets the session variable given the key and attribute
        Parameters:
        request - - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the session info
        key - - Key for the session variable to set
        attribute - - Value for the session variable to set

      • removeSessionVariable

        public static void removeSessionVariable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         java.lang.String key)
        Removes the session variable matching the key from the current session
        Parameters:
        request - - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the session info
        key - - Key for the session variable to remove from the session

      • verifyLogin

        public WrapperObject<Person> verifyLogin(java.lang.String userName,
                                java.lang.String password)
        Verifies that the inputted username and password matches a legitimate
 user in the datastore. This is used for login validation. If user is valid,
 then WrapperObject user is returned (primarily for putting into the session
 if the client so desires).
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:
        the WrapperObject

      • verifyUser

        public boolean verifyUser()
        Verifies that the username for the Auth object isn't null
 Would have been previously set through one of the constructors.
 This verifies that a user is logged in, but not which user.
        Returns:
        true is a user is logged in.

      • verifyAdmin

        public boolean verifyAdmin()
        Verifies that the username for the Auth object isn't null
 and that the access level is set to Admin. This verifies that 
 an admin user is logged in, but not which admin.
        Returns:
        true is an admin is logged in.

      • verifyUser

        public boolean verifyUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Verifies that the username for the Auth object isn't null
 This verifies that a user is logged in, but not which user.
 Sets the response object to redirect to "/" if a user is not logged in. Won't
 redirect until calling location "returns".
        Returns:
        true is a user is logged in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • verifyAdmin

        public boolean verifyAdmin(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Verifies that the username for the Auth object isn't null
 and that the access level is set to Admin. This verifies that 
 an admin user is logged in, but not which admin.
 Sets the response object to redirect to "/" if an admin is not logged in. Won't
 redirect until calling location "returns".
        Returns:
        true is an admin is logged in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • destroySession

        public static void destroySession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Invalidates the current session which as a side-effect, destroys the session variables.
        Parameters:
        request -

      • getAuth

        public static Auth getAuth(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Public accessor method for an Auth object.
        Parameters:
        request -
        Returns:
        an instantiated Auth object. Object is instantiated with
 the username and accesslevel of the currently logged in 
 user (WrapperObject object in the session variables).
